report.title: Charles II, 1660
report.subtitle: Chapter IX. An Act for the speedy provision of money for disbanding and paying off the forces of this Kingdome both byLand and Sea. [Rot. Parl. 12 C. II. p. 1. nu. 8.]

section.head: The Reasons for passing this A&bholigct;.

para.emph: Noblemen and their eldest Sons of the Age of 21.; A Baronet.; A Knight of the Bath.; Knight Batchelor.; King's Sergeant.; Esquires.; Widows rated at One-third according to Rank of Husbands.

section.para: Whereas the present raising of great s&bhouov;mes of money for the speedy disbanding of the forces both by Land and Sea is a matter of vast consequence and urgent necessity soe that not onely the happines and peace of his Majestyes Kingdomes, but alsoe the well being and prosperity of them depends upon it, which said summes of money cannot be soe suddainely raised as the pressing occasions doe require without some extraordinary meanes used, to the which all his Majestyes subje&bholigct;s in this visible exigence of the Kingdome will heartily and cheerfully submitt seeing it is to free themselves from soe great a burthen and dayly increesing charge May it therefore please your most Excellent Majesty that it may be ena&bholigct;ed And be it ena&bholigct;ed by the Kings Most Excellent Majesty and by the Lords and Commons in this present Parliament assembled and by the authority of the same that all and every person and persons who at the time of the execution of this A&bholigct; shall be of the severall rankes and degrees hereafter mentioned shall to the purpose afforesaid contribute and pay the severall summes of money hereafter in this A&bholigct; sett downe and appointed that is to say Every person of the degree of a Duke of England Scotland or Ireland inhabiting and residing within this Kingdome shall pay the summe of one hundred pound&bholngs;. Every person of the degree of a Marquesse of any of the said Kingdomes inhabiting and residing within this Kingdome shall pay the summe of fowerscore pound&bholngs;. Every person of the degree of an Earle of any of the said three Kingdomes and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome the summe of threescore pound&bholngs;. Every person of the degree of a Viscount of any of the said three Kingdomes and inhabiting and residing within this Kingdome the summe of fifty pound&bholngs;. Every person of the degree of a Baron of any of the said three Kingdomes and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome the summe of forty pound&bholngs;. Every eldest sonne of a Duke of any of the said three Kingdomes and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome being of the age of one and twenty yeares the summe of threescore pound&bholngs;. Every eldest sonne of a Marquesse of any of the said Kingdomes and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome being of the age of one and twenty yeares the summe of fifty pound&bholngs;. The eldest sonne of an Earle of any of the said three Kingdomes and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome being of the age of one and twenty yeares the summe of forty pound&bholngs;. Every eldest sonne of a Viscount of any of the said three Kingdomes and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome being of the age of one and twenty yeares the summe of thirty five pound&bholngs;. Every eldest sonne of a Baron of any of the said three Kingdomes, and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome being of the age of one and twenty yeares thirty pound&bholngs;. Every person of the degree of a Baronet of any of the said three Kingdomes or of Nova Scotia and inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome the summe of thirty pound&bholngs;. Every person that is a Knight of the Order of the Bath inhabiting or residing within this Kingdome the summe of thirty pound&bholngs;. Every person who is a Knight Batchelor inhabiting & residing within this Kingdome the summe of twenty pound&bholngs;. Every Sergeant at Law the summe of twenty pound&bholngs;. Every person of the degree of an Esquire, or soe reputed, inhabiting and residing within this Kingdome and above the age of one and twenty yeares the summe of ten pound&bholngs;. Every Widow respe&bholigct;ively according to her husbands degree, shall pay the third part [by this A&bholigct;3] rated [by this A&bholigct;1] upon that degree of which the husband of such Widdow was in his life time.

section.head: II. Parsons.
section.para: Do&bholigct;ors in Law. Advocates. Judges, &c. in Courts of Admiralty, &c. Do&bholigct;ors in Physic.

And Bee it further ena&bholigct;ed and ordained that all and every person and persons of the severall rankes and degrees hereafter in this A&bholigct; mentioned shall to the purpose aforesaid contribute and pay the severall summes of money hereafter in this A&bholigct; sett downe and appointed, that is to say Every Parson or Vicar being possessed of a Parsonage or Vicarage or other Estate of the cleare yearely value of one hundred pound&bholngs; the summe of forty shillings. Every Do&bholigct;or in the civill, or canon Lawes and every Advocate the summe of five pound&bholngs;. Every person who is a Judge or C&bhooov;missioner in the Courts of Admiralty or of the probate of Wills the summe of twenty pound&bholngs;. Every person who hath pra&bholigct;ised as a Pro&bholigct;or in either of the Courts aforesaid the summe of five pound&bholngs;, Every Do&bholigct;or of Phisicke the summe of ten pound&bholngs;.

section.head: III. Lord Mayor Aldermen, &c. of London.

para.emph: Masters, Wardens, Livery Men, and Yeomen of Companies in London.; Hackney Coach Masters.; Merchant Strangers.; Alien Traders.; English Merchants and Fa&bholigct;ors of London.; Aldermen of any City.

section.para: And Bee it further ena&bholigct;ed and ordained by the authority aforesaid that all and every person and persons of the severall degrees and qualities hereafter mentioned shall to the purpose aforesaid contribute and pay the severall summes of money hereafter mentioned and sett downe in this A&bholigct;, that is to say The Lord Maior of the Citty of London shall pay the summe of forty pound&bholngs;. Every such person who [either 4] is now Sheriffe or Alderman of the said Citty of London, or hath fined for Sheriffe or Alderman of London the summe of twenty pound&bholngs;. Every person who hath beene or now is Deputy to any Alderman within the said Citty ten pound&bholngs;. The Towne Clarke [of4] London twenty pound&bholngs;. Every person who is of the Common Councell of the said Citty the summe of five pound&bholngs;. Every person who hath beene or now is Master of any of the twelve first companies of the said Citty, or hath fined for Master of any of the said twelve companies the summe of ten pound&bholngs;. Every person who hath beene or now is Warden of any of the said twelve first Companies of the said Citty, or hath fined for Warden of [any of4] the said Companies six pound&bholngs; thirteene shillings and fower pence, Every person who is of the Livery of any of the said twelve first companies the summe of five pound&bholngs;. Every person who is of the Yeomanry of either of the said twelve first companies three pound&bholngs;. Every person who is or hath beene Master of either of the companies of Diers Brewers Leather Sellers Girdlers Stationers Woodmongers Upholsters Pothecaries Pewterers Tallow-Chandlers Armorers or Sadlers the summe of six pound&bholngs;. Every person who hath beene Warden of either of the said Companies five pound&bholngs;. Every person who is of the Livery of any of the said Companies three pound&bholngs;. Every person who is of the Yeomanry of the said Companies one pound. Every person who hath beene or is Master of any of the companyes of Barber Chirurgions White Bakers Wax Chandlers Cutlers Butchers Carpenters Painters Cordwayners Coopers Scriveners Browne Bakers Turners or Inholders the summe of three pound&bholngs;. Every person who is or hath beene Warden of any of the said Companies two pound&bholngs;. Every person who is of the Livery of any of the said Companyes one pound. Every person who is or hath beene Master of either of the Companies of Founders Curryers Masons Bricklayers Joyners Plaisterers Weavers Fruterers Marblers Imbroyderers Poulterers Cooks or Plumbers the summe of one pound. Every person who is or hath beene Wardon of any of the said Companies fifteene shillings, Every person that is of the Livery of the said Companies ten shillings. Every person who is or hath beene of the Livery of either of the Companies of Bowyers Fletchers Blackesmithes Botlemakers Woolpackers Farriers Paviers Loriners Glasiers Clerks or Watermen five shillings. Every person who is a Freeman of any Company within the Citty of London the summe of one shilling. Every person that keepeth one or more Hackney Choaches shall pay for every Hackney Choach and paire of Horses that he soe keepeth the summe of ten shillings. Every person who is a Merchant Stranger if he be of the degree of a Knight the summe of forty pound&bholngs;, if below that degree and he be a Merchant trading to Sea the summe of ten pound&bholngs;, if trading within the Land the s&bhouov;me of five pound&bholngs;. Every person being an Alien borne and useing or exerciseing any trade, mistery, or manuall occupation within any of the Cittyes or Corporations of this Kingdome being a Housekeeper the summe of ten shillings. Every person who is an English merchant inhabiting and residing in or about the said Citty of London, and not free of the said Citty the summe of ten pound&bholngs;. Every English Fa&bholigct;or residing within the said Citty the summe of forty shillings. Every person who is or hath beene an Alderman in any City within this Kingdome if he be below the degree of a Knight or Esquire the summe of five pound&bholngs;.

section.head: IV. Officers of the Courts of Chancery and King's Bench.
section.para: Warden of the Fleet.; Officers of the Courts of Chancery.; Officers of the Court of Common Pleas.; Officers of the Treasury, Exchequer, Duchy Court, &c.; Attornies at Law.; Officers in His Majesty's Household.; Single Persons above 16.; All other Persons not before rated nor receiving Alms.; The said Rates to be paid in London, and within 10 miles, within Six Days after Proclamation of A&bholigct;. In all other Counties, &c. within Twelve Days.

And be it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authority aforesaid that all and every such person and persons who is possessed of any of the severall Offices or Places hereafter mentioned in their owne rights shall pay the severall summes hereafter sett downe that is to say The Prothonatary of the Court of Kings Bench the summe of One hundred pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Crowne of the Court of Kings Bench aforesaid twenty pound&bholngs;. The Custos Brevium of the said Court forty pound&bholngs;. The Marshall of the Kings Bench fifty pound&bholngs;. The Master of the Rolls threescore pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Crowne in the Court of Chauncery forty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Rules in the Kings Bench ten pound&bholngs;. The Warden of the Fleet fifty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Hannaper forty pound&bholngs;. The Master of the Subpena Office forty pound&bholngs;. The Clerks of the Inrollment ten pound&bholngs; apeice. The Usher of the Court of Chauncery thirty pound&bholngs;. Every one of the Six Clerks in the said Court of Chauncery forty pound&bholngs;. Every Cursitor of the said Court ten pound&bholngs;. Every Clerke of the Petty Bag five pound&bholngs;. Every Examiner of the said Court ten pound&bholngs;. The Cheife Register in the said Court of Chauncery twenty pound&bholngs;. Every Under Register the summe of ten pound&bholngs;. Every person that is admited as an Underclerke in any of the Offices of the Six Clerks in Chancery the summe of three pound&bholngs;. The Clerks of the Chappell of the Rolls three pound&bholngs; apeice. Every Prothonotary of the Court of Common Pleas the summe of fifty pound&bholngs;. The Custos Brevium of the said Court fowerscore pounds. Every Philezer of the said Court ten pound&bholngs;. The Master of the Fine Office thirty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Warrants ten pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Outlawryes twenty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Kings Silver Office twenty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of [the4] Statutes twenty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Treasury ten pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Habeas Corpora Office ten pound&bholngs;. The Exigenter of the Citty of London forty pound&bholngs;. Every other Exigenter in the Common Pleas five pound&bholngs;. The Kings Remembrancer in the Court of Exchequer the summe of forty pound&bholngs;. The Lord Treasurers Remembrancer in the said Court the s&bhouov;me of ten pound&bholngs;. Every of the Tellers of the Court of Exchequer twenty pound&bholngs; apiece. Every Attourney of the Court of Exchequer belonging to the Office of the Kings Remembrancer ten pound&bholngs;. Every Attourney of the Office of Pleas in the Court of Exchequer ten pound&bholngs;. The Remembrancer of First Fruits and Tenthes in the said Court the s&bhouov;me of twenty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Pipe in the said Court the summe of forty pound&bholngs;. The Forraigne Opposer in the said Court the summe of twenty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Estreates in the said Court the summe of twenty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Pleas in the said Court the summe of thirty pound&bholngs;. The Auditor of the Receipt of the Exchequer the summe of forty pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Pell in the receipt aforesaid thirty pound&bholngs;. The Usher of the said Court of Exchequer the summe of twenty pound&bholngs;. Every Attourney in the Office of Pleas in the said Court of Exchequer ten pound&bholngs;. Every Auditor in the said Court ten pound&bholngs;. The Clerke of the Court of the Dutchy of Lancaster ten pound&bholngs;. Every Auditor of the said Court ten pound&bholngs;. Every Clerke of the Privy Seale ten pound&bholngs;. Every Clerke of the Signet ten pound&bholngs;. Every Attourney at Law of any of the Courts at Westminster or in the Courts of Law or Equity within any of the Countyes Palatine of Chester Lancaster or Durham or Marches of Wales the summe of three pound&bholngs;. Every person in any Office or place under his Majesty (except his Majestyes Household Servants in ordinary) who receiveth the yearely fee of ten pound&bholngs; the summe of ten pound&bholngs;. The Leiutenant of the Tower of London fifty pound&bholngs;. Every person that can dispend in Lands Leases Money Stocke or otherwise of his or her owne proper estate one hundred pound&bholngs; per annum the summe of forty shillings and soe proportionably for a greater or lesser estate provided it extend not to persons under five pound&bholngs; yearely. Every person being a single person and above the age of sixteene yeares the summe of twelve pence. And every other person of what estate or degree soe-ever he or she be within his Majestyes Kingdome of England and Dominion of Wales not rated before in this present A&bholigct;, nor receiving Alms, and being above sixteene yeares of age shall pay six pence. And all the severall persons of the severall degrees ranks and qualityes before sett forth in this Bill shall pay the severall proportions and rates appointed by this Bill [in manner & forme5] to be disposed of as in this present A&bholigct; hereafter is expressed that is to say Every person of the severall degrees ranks and qualityes before mentioned within the Citty of London and ten miles from the same shall within six dayes after proclamation made of this A&bholigct; in the accustomed places within the said Citty, and the severall Countyes within the said distance respe&bholigct;ively pay the severall rates appointed by this A&bholigct; to be paid by them, and every person of what degree ranke or quality soe-ever throughout the Kingdome of England and Dominion of Wales within twelve dayes after proclamation made of this A&bholigct; in the accustomed places of the severall Countyes shall pay the severall rates appointed by this A&bholigct; to be paid by them.

section.head: V. Commissioners named
section.para: And Be it further ena&bholigct;ed and ordained by the authority aforesaid that for the better assessing, ordering and leavying of the said summes of money soe limitted and appointed by this A&bholigct; to be paid as aforesaid all and every the persons hereafter named, shall be and are hereby appointed constituted and authorised to be Commissioners for the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Countyes Cittyes Burroughes Townes and Places within the Kingdome of England Dominion of Wales or Towne of Berwicke upon Tweed hereafter mentioned.

section.head: V. Commissioners may execute A&bholigct; without further Commission.
section.para: Commissioners may divide themselves; and dire&bholigct; Precepts to Inhabitants, & c. to appear, and at such Appearance read the said Rates, and charge them how to make their Certificates, &c.; and after such Charge prefix another Day and Place for Appearance & bringing in Certificate Penalty 40s. ; Commissioners to make Precept to Colle&bholigct;ors containing Names of Persons Presented in Certificate.; Commissioners suspe&bholigct;ing Value of Estates; to set Rate Persons refusing to pay Rate; Officers may distrain.; If Rate not paid within Four Days, Distress appraised and sold for Payment of Rates, &c. Overplus paid to Owner of Good&bholngs;. Officer charged only for his Portion; and to pay same to Commissioners; Commissioners to pay same to Sheriff; Sheriff to pay same to Treasurers.; Rates paid in current Money.

And Bee it further ena&bholigct;ed and ordained that the [severall175] Commissioners aforesaid shall have full power and authority by vertue of this A&bholigct; without any further Commission to putt the effe&bholigct; of this A&bholigct; in execution and in order thereunto shall in their respe&bholigct;ive Countyes Cittyes Burroughes Townes and Places meete together at the most usuall and common place of meeting within each of the said Countyes Cittyes Burroughs Townes and Places respe&bholigct;ively within foure dayes after the proclayining of this A&bholigct;, and the said Commissioners or soe many of them as shall be present at the said first generall meeting or the major part of them may by their consents and agreements sever themselves for the execution of this A&bholigct; in Hundreds Rapes Wapentakes Wards Townes and other places within their limits [in such manner & forme175] as to them shall seeme expedient and shall dire&bholigct; their severall or joynt precept or precepts to such Inhabitants High Constables Petty Constables Bailiffes and other like Officers and Ministers and such number of them and as in and by this A&bholigct; is appointed, and at such their appearances the said Commissioners or soe many of them as shall be therunto appointed shall openly read or cause to be read unto them the said rates in this A&bholigct; mentioned, and openly declare the effe&bholigct; of their charge unto them, and how and in what manner they ought and should make their certificats according to the rates and summes therof abovesaid, and of all manner of persons as well Aliens and Strangers Denizens or not Denizens inhabiting within this Realme as of such popish Recusants and other persons who be borne under the Kings obeysance chargeable by this A&bholigct; and after such charge given shall at the discretion of the [same176] Commissioners or any three of them prefix another day and place to the said persons to appeare before the said Commissioners and bring in their certificates under the penalty of forty shillings for every default, and therupon at the said day and place prefixed and limited the said Commissioners shall make their precept or precepts to such Officers or Colle&bholigct;ors being able and sufficient men in every Hundred Wapentake towne or [other175] place aforesaid as they the said Commissioners or any three or more of them shall thinke fitt, comprising and containing in them the names and surnames of all persons presented before them in the said Certificates, of whom or of any of them if the said Commissioners or any three of them in their severall limitts shall have certaine knowledge, or vehement suspe&bholigct; that he or she is of greater value then is upon such person or persons soe certified or specified, that then the said C&bhooov;missioners shall upon examination thereof by good and lawfull meanes without oath set such rate or rates upon every such person or persons as shall be according to the true intent and meaning of this A&bholigct;, and if any person or persons shall refuse to pay the severall summes and proportions appointed by this A&bholigct; for such person to pay upon demand made by the Constable or Officer of the said place according to the Estreats delivered to them by the said Commissioners, it shall be lawfull to and for such Constable or Officer for non payment thereof to destraine the person or persons soe refuseing by his [and177] their Good&bholngs; and chattels, and the distresse soe taken to keepe by the space of fower dayes at the costs and charges of the owner thereof, And if the said Owner doe not pay the said summe of money, due by this A&bholigct; within the said foure dayes, then the said distresse to be apprised by three or two of the Inhabitants where such distresse is taken and then to be sould by the said Officer for the payment of the said money, and the overplus comeing by the said Sale (if any be) over and above the charged of takeing and keeping the said distresse to be immediately restored to the Owner their of, and the said Officers and other persons soe deputed to aske take gather and leavy the said summes shall answere and be charged for the portion onely to them assigned and limitted to be leavyed gathered and comprised in the said Writing and estreate soe to them as aforesaid delivered to the persons and uses in this A&bholigct; expressed, and the said summe in that writing or estreat to be comprized to pay unto the said Commissioners, or any three of them with all speede and without delay at such day and place as by them shall be appointed, and the said Commissioners to whom the said summes or any of them shall be paid shall with all speede and without delay carry and pay the same unto the Sheriffe or Sheriffes of the said County or Citty respe&bholigct;ively wherin the said summes shall or ought to be colle&bholigct;ed and paid, and every such Sheriffe respe&bholigct;ively within the Kingdome of England, and Dominion of Wales shall with all speede and without delay pay or cause to be paid all and every the s&bhouov;mes by him or them received to the Treasurers in this A&bholigct; named, or any three of them, all and every which said summe and summes of money soe to be paid by force and vertue of this A&bholigct; shall bee paid in currant money of England,

section.head: VI. Persons dissuading others from paying Rate, or consenting that any other Person shall be under-rated.
section.para: And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed that if any person or persons shall disswade any other person from paying the rates or summes soe to [to178] bee rated as aforesaid by force or vertue or according to the tenor of this A&bholigct;, or by corruption shall give consent that any person shall be rated below or under the proportion which any such person ought to pay by the true intent and meaning of this A&bholigct;, and the said Offences or any of them shall be proved by oath of two Wittnesses before any three or more of the said Commissioners who shall have power by this A&bholigct; to administer the said Oath, shall by the said Commissioners or any three or more of them be committed to the common goale of the same County (except they be Peeres of the Realme) there to remaine till he or she shall be thence delivered by the Justices of Assize, or Justices of the Peace at the Generall Quarter Sessions to be holden for the same County wherein any such offence shall be comitted.

section.head: VII. Sums colle&bholigct;ed to be issued by Treasurers to the Uses in this A&bholigct;
section.para: mentioned. Officers making Default in colle&bholigct;ing, &c.; accountable before Parliament.

And Be it further ena&bholigct;ed that all and every the summes to be colle&bholigct;ed and raised by and according to the tenor of this A&bholigct; shall be paid and issued out by the [Treasurerers179] in this A&bholigct; named or any two or more of them respe&bholigct;ively to the use and uses in this present A&bholigct; mentioned and noe other, as by order of the Lords and Commons, or of such persons as they shall authorize therunto shall be appointed and dire&bholigct;ed and not otherwise, and that all and every the said person and persons who are to be charged or chargable with the receipt of any the said summes in this A&bholigct; mentioned, which shall willfully [negclet,180] or make default in the colle&bholigct;ing leavying or paying of the severall summes by them or any of them respe&bholigct;ively to be received or paid, or in execution of their severall dutyes [according to the tenor181] and true meaning of this A&bholigct; shall be accomptable for the same to the Parliament, and shall be lyable to such punishment as shall bee thought fitt by the Parliament to be infli&bholigct;ed,

section.head: VIII. Persons residing in London or within 15 Miles paying before the time limited to the Persons herein named as Treasurers;

para.emph: to receive an Acquittance, and taken to be an acceptable Service.

section.para: And It is further ena&bholigct;ed and declared by the authoritie aforesaid that if any person or persons of what degree ranke or quality soever inhabiting or residing within the Citty of London, or within fifteene Miles distant from the said Citty shall before the time limitted by this A&bholigct; pay unto Sir Richard Browne Baronet, Sir John Langham Baronet Sir William Wheeler Knight Sir William Vincent Knight Thomas Rich Esquire and the Chamberlaine of the Citty of London for the time being, (who are hereby constituted and appointed Treasurers for the receiving and issueing of all & singuler the summes of money by this A&bholigct; intended to be raised) or unto any two of them, and shall receive from the said Treasurers or any two of them a Certificate or acquittance acknowledging the receipt of such summes, the said partyes severally shall thereby be discharged of for or concerning the said summes and all such payments shall be taken as an acceptable service to his Majestye and the Kingdome

section.head: IX. Persons lending £100. or upward&bholngs; declared a good Service.
section.para: And it is further ena&bholigct;ed and declared by the authoritie aforesaid that if any person or persons shall lend the summe of one hundred pound&bholngs; or any greater summe to and for the use and purposes in this present A&bholigct; mentioned and declared such person shall doe very good and acceptable service to the Kingdome

section.head: X. Persons, &c; lending before 1st Aug. 1660.,

para.emph: Repayment secured with Interest at £6. per Cent. per Annum.

section.para: And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed that any person [or persons181] that shall soe lend and advance such summe or summes of money as aforesaid for this present occasion and shall before the first day of August one thousand six hundred and sixty ensueing pay and deliver the same to such person or persons as are authorized by this present A&bholigct; to receive the moneyes charged hereby upon the respe&bholigct;ive Inhabitants of the Citty of London shall be secured by this A&bholigct; for the repayment of the said moneyes at such time and place as by the lenders of the said moneyes shall be required and agreed upon, and alsoe of the interest and dammage sustained by the forbearance thereof after the rate of six pound&bholngs; per cent. for a yeare and untill such time as they shall respe&bholigct;ively have received againe the said summes soe lent and advanced,

section.head: XI. Treasurers to repay such Loans out of the Rates received by them, with Interest at £6. per Cent. per Annum.
section.para: And be it further ena&bholigct;ed that the said Sir Richard Browne Sir John Langham Sir William Wheeler Sir William Vincent Thomas Rich and the Chamberlaine of London shall and may satisfie pay and deliver unto such person or persons respe&bholigct;ively out of the said moneyes soe to be received by them such respe&bholigct;ive summe and summes of money as shall be soe lent by him or them for the purposes aforesaid together with such other and further summe and summes of money as the interest of, and for the said summe and summes of money respe&bholigct;ively shall amount unto after the rate of six pound&bholngs; per cent. for a yeare from the day and time, that the same was advanced as aforesaid, untill they shall respe&bholigct;ively have received the said summe or summes soe advanced,

section.head: XII. Acquittances from Persons appointed for Receipt of Rates a sufficient Discharge to Treasurers.
section.para: And it is hereby [further181] ena&bholigct;ed that the acquittance or acquittances from the persons before apointed for the receipt of these moneyes to the uses and purposes in this present A&bholigct; expressed or of any three of them shall be a sufficient discharge to the Treasurers in this A&bholigct; named for soe much money together with interest for the same as shall be comprehended in such acquittance or acquittainces for the issueing out, and payment of the said summe and summes of money respe&bholigct;ively,

section.head: XIII. Allowance to Colle&bholigct;ors, Id. in the pound. Allowance to Commissioners' Clerks, Id. in the pound.
section.para: And Bee it further ena&bholigct;ed that there shall be allowed and paid by the C&bhooov;missioners aforesaid unto the respe&bholigct;ive Colle&bholigct;ors of every parish the summe of one penny in the pound for all such summes of money as they shall colle&bholigct; and pay in according to this A&bholigct;, and the said Commissioners shall likewise allow and pay out of the moneyes soe colle&bholigct;ed and paid in one penny in the pound unto their Clerks and others imployed by them in this service.

section.head: XIV. Treasurers to pay to Sheriffs residing 50 Miles or upward&bholngs; from London 2d. in the Pound, and within that Distance 1d. Allowance to Treasurers of 1d. in the Pound.
section.para: And Bee it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid that the severall Treasurers in this A&bholigct; named shall allow and pay unto the respe&bholigct;ive Sheriffs of the severall Countyes residing fifty miles distant from the Citty of London or upward&bholngs; two pence in the pound, and to such respe&bholigct;ive Sheriffes as shall reside within that distance from the said Citty of London one penny in the pound for all such summes of money as the said Sheriffes shall pay in respe&bholigct;ively unto the Treasurers in this A&bholigct; named, and the said Treasurers in this A&bholigct; named are hereby further authorized to have and take unto themselves one penny in the pound out of the moneys soe paid in unto them by vertue of this A&bholigct; to be distributed unto such person or persons as shall be imployed by them in receiving and issueing of the money in and by this A&bholigct; granted in such manner and proportions as they shall thinke fitt.

section.head: XV. Rates upon Peers to be received by a Colle&bholigct;or nominated by them, who is to pay the same to the Treasurers.
section.para: Provided alwayes And be it hereby declared and ena&bholigct;ed that the severall rates taxed upon the Lords shall be received by a Colle&bholigct;or to be nominated by the Peers, which Colle&bholigct;or soe appointed by the Peeres shall pay over the said summes to the Treasurers in this A&bholigct; named to be disposed of to such uses and purposes as by this A&bholigct; is appointed.

section.head: XVI. No Double Charge allowed.
section.para: Provided likewise that noe person or persons of what degree or quality soever shall be doubly charged by this A&bholigct; but that every person shall pay the greatest proportion he or she is charged withall by this A&bholigct;.

section.head: XVII. Rates received to be employed in paying Arrears, &c. to the Army and Navy in Pay on the 10th June 1660. Account of Rates received to be given to Parliament.
section.para: And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritye aforesaid that all and every the summe and summes of money to be leavyed and raised by vertue of this present A&bholigct; shall (by the Treasurers in and by this A&bholigct; appointed) be imployed and disposed for and towards the paying of the arreares disbanding and discharging the respe&bholigct;ive forces of this kingdome by Land and Sea who were in pay the tenth day of June One thousand six hundred and sixty, and to noe other use or purpose whatsoever, and that an accompt of all the said moneyes shall be given by the said Treasurers to this or the next or any other succeeding Parliament, or to such person or persons as shall by this or any other succeeding parliament be thereunto appointed.

section.head: XVIII. Persons assessed higher than their Rank to be assessed by Persons herein named.
section.para: [Provided that if any of the Peeres be assessed higher then according to his or their ranke or degree perticularly expressed in this A&bholigct;, they shall be assessed by George Duke of Albemarle John Marquesse of Winchester Henry Marquesse of Dorchester Algernoone Earle of Northumberland William Lord Paget Philip Lord Wharton John Lord Hunsden and Henry Lord Arundell or any five of them.182]
section.note: annexed to the Original A&bholigct; in a separate Schedule.
Phillip Parker Henry North of Laxfield O.
annexed to the Original A&bholigct; in a separate Schedule.
